name: The Hyperfactorial
description:
Description

In mathematics, and more specifically number theory, the hyperfactorial of a positive integer `$n$` is the product of the numbers `$1^1 , 2^2, ..., n^n $`: `$H(n) = 1^1 \times 2^2 \times 3^3 \times ... \times (n-1)^{n-1} \times n^n$` `$H(n) = \prod_{i=1}^{n} i^i $` Check out this Wikipedia article for more detail

Your task

Implement a function `hyperfact(num)` that takes a positive integer `num` and returns the hyperfactorial of it. In order for your answer not to be too messy (hyperfactorial of 100 is 9015 digits long) give the answer modulo 1000000007.

Notes

`1 <= n <= 300` `50` random tests
